lender.name: Whistleblower
lender.loan_because:
I've begun questioning if Kiva and similar funds/schemes are on balance a force of good.
We can all agree that between the average Kiva benefactor and the average beneficiary something worthwhile happens and I understand the response that Kiva is a community fostering charity... but I think someone has to make the point that this facebook of charity is not really tackling core issues of government,democracy and the rule of law in any consistent way.
This is why our money are better spent with established and experienced organisations like UNESCO and the Red Cross (make ur own list) - who have been in this minefield for decades.
However this is slow and to be honest abstract - no results this side of christmas which is why I call charity depressing, and depressing does not sell so you have to jazz it up a bit with some nice prospects and stories with happy endings. This has even reflected into some of the established charities who are no longer just helping children - in stead people now have to "foster" a child somewhere suitably horrible, so they can have pictures of little "umdedembengo" on their fridge door to show to people. People do good for a reason, I know. I recently went to a charitable event and it was filled with single men with their hair all gelled up, all extremely busy doing good.
So let's all get over ourselves and admit that there is some self profiling involved in all this- and then maybe we can start discussing whether this Kiva style "have your picture taken in front of a goat and get some cash" facebook of charity is really the best way to spend money in developing countries.
Again - I am not attacking you or your specific loans - I am questioning the overall effect and saying that this convenience store "charity with a smile on the end" that Kiva offers, will lure people looking to help into a false sense of having done the best they can.
It's wishful thinking - it's much more complex than this. Surely if you look at your portfolio you can see that it's not exactly world hunger looking back at you?

lender.loan_because: Micro lending opens the door for anyone to be able to afford giving despite their level of income. However, Kiva allows me the flexibility to give whenever I can.
lender.occupational_info: First and foremost I enjoy life and enjoy people. I don't put the highest value on money, but rather on life experiences, family and friends. I enjoy creating and sharing visions for new possibilities and business ideas and then being actively involved in launching them with a mission that it may someday help others grow. Some of my visions have created businesses that ended in bankruptcy and others as multi-million dollar businesses. I don't fear failure. I believe that if you don't keep on trying you can never really succeed. I encourage others to have courage, self-respect, integrity and to maintain the willingness to press forward no matter what comes their way.

lender.occupational_info:
I loan companies money when I invest in their company's shares from my computer or by telephone all over the world.
My brokerage firm can provide me with a stock certificate if I request or post it electronically into my account.
When I buy their company shares at say $25.00 per share. I'll wait for the shares to go up in price maybe to $30.00 or $50.00
I can place a order to sell the stock or hold for a long-term investment.
In 3 trading days once the stock had settled (my transaction cleared) I can write a check or use the VISA debit card my brokerage firm Scottrade to withdraw the profit or I have the choice of reinvesting my profits into the same or a different company.
Its fun to me I have a passion to trade stocks under .01 to $5.00 and currency (FX/money) I treat my trading as a business.

We support over 40 causes, donating 10% of the proceeds of the sale to a related non-profit organization in an effort to raise donations for research and care programs.
